keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Soble from Tokyo, Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea, and Yufan Huang from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The president’s visit to Vietnam and particularly Japan highlights old grievances as well as the current power struggles among nations big and small in Asia.

headline.print_headline: Obama Legacy Taking Shape at Hiroshima
headline.main: In Obama’s Visit to Hiroshima, a Complex Calculus of Asian Politics

snippet: The president’s visit to Vietnam and particularly Japan highlights old grievances as well as the current power struggles among nations big and small in Asia.
abstract: Pres Obama's visit to Hiroshima will mark first time United States president has visited city since atomic weapon was used on it during World War II, but also represents latest move on Obama's part to curb proliferation of nuclear weapons and signal shift of focus toward Asia; visit also underscores degree to which politics in region have changed.
